E46r5oAKgsQ4OPElR4v15g.text: Always busy. Always delicious. It can get a bit cosy at the communal table so it's better for smaller parties You'll quickly forget how cramped you feel when the food arrives. The selection of breads is a wonderful starter. You can take a look at all of the cold dishes in the case. Not  to mention, all of the fabulous desserts. Pick up some zatar or sumac on the way out. It's all pretty affordable and great if you're making Ottolenghi's recipes from any of their cookbooks.

UumWaFX6XSUbBAFKmTkm_Q.text: Vegetarian's delight! The variety of veggie fare on offer here is astounding and so refreshing as it's not common you find such tasty and varied options for meat-avoiders. I'm not vegetarian myself but my other half is, so I have sampled a couple of the meat/fish dishes too which are also delicious. Puddings are lovely, we've had the passionfruit meringue and the chocolate torte, both very good. The staff are lovely, really knowledgeable and generous - we were able to try the orange wine which we'd never heard of before, and we learnt the difference between organic and biodynamic wine. Both times we've been we were given an individual two-person table rather than the group seating, which is nice though I'm sure the group seating is fine too. We paid £50/pp for 5 dishes, one dessert and a bottle of wine. Bit pricey on our budget but perfect for an occasional birthday treat.

KcQYxUyXkbNyItBng6kSDQ.text: I am posting the same review for two locations because the food in both locations is equally excellent (see below). The only difference between the Knotting Hill and Islington locations is the seating areas. The Islington location has a larger, brighter and more spacious communal seating areas than Knotting Hill.Every food items here is truly unique and true to an idea. The selections vary, there are choices of manny different types of salads and add on mains. But do not be fooled, a salad is not always what you think. The aubergine salad is a meal in itself. And the flavors are rich and varied. You can easily taste many choices with combination of three salads as part of your main.Service is what you would expect in a communal eating experience, fine but not fast. You can always take away food (we prefer after we eat there first).And do not forget to stop buy and grab various cookies and other amazing items (I am looking at you spiced nuts!) on the way out.Recap: go there, go there now. It is the essence of good, fresh food is all about, without any of the pretension and bs.

L0rsnbV0U6OV6YNJORMMzQ.text: Otto-legend-iI have discovered the most decadently delectable almond croissant... possibly in the world. Be prepared to eat your weight in marzipan, wrapped in the buttery folds of an already seductive croissant, sprinkled with soft ground almonds and confectioners sugar.Thank the heavens they don't advertise the calorie count otherwise you might just induce that heart attack that you are already slowly contributing to by consumption of this truly licentious morsel...It is not possible to eat badly in this place. You may have to practice your standing skills - as to sit for a meal is always a wait.Alternatively you can follow me and have your wild rice and feta salad, plum frangipani tarts, tomato-pesto-goats cheese muffins, orange-oatmeal scones, herb-and-olive oil-tossed sweet potatoes and marinated aubergine antipasti packaged in beautiful little white boxes by the polite serving staff and take it all away for immediate home consumption.

2ElyR5dFWCYoPa0iyFjqEQ.text: Totally overrated. Waited for months to get a reservation for 3 people. Finally did on a Tuesday at 5 pm, and it was SO not worth it! The menu wasn't that impressive and the food is OK... totally not worth the price tag. If you do go, I'd recommend indulging in the desserts (for takeaway, no way will you get a table) and skipping the rest.

H5TNrKXf2X10lMarxzsqFA.text: I'd give this place 3.5 stars.Another chain in London that I've heard decent things.  Came here with my friend for breakfast.  The place looked slightly sterile (white walls, minimalistic), and my friend said it smelled like "new paint."Service was great.  The waiter was nice and quick to take order.  Not many selection from the menu, which is fine.  I had the French Toast with mocha.  Nothing extraordinary about either item.  My friend had oatmeal and also thought it was ok.Not a bad place to go for breakfast.

Sfq7d2wKru30J2QeEKfFeQ.text: Having booked a table weeks and weeks ago I was not willing to give it up, even though I was (and still am) in a depressed mood. So, please excuse if i'm being rather harsh, but the above still applies. Of course, you can just walk in and hope, but I hate waiting and in my current state would cry  tears of despair, if left standing more than 5min.The place itself always looks amazingly appealing from the outside. The display of cakes and meringue has me salivating ... and we had some for dessert. Pure bliss. Get it for take away if you don't have time. We had one of the smaller tables on the side  booked and were seen by a waitress straight away.  Not sure I would have liked to sit on the communal tables as I'm rather far reaching with my elbows, but it could be fun starting new friendships that way. After taking our place, we were told that all the meals come starter sized so we best choose 5 to 6, to make it an evening. Ahhh, not with these prices, luv. We decided to have two cold and two warm options .... and yes ... they were all amazingly delicious and good looking. I would recommend this as a First Date place: if  A) you're going out with a suit who pays and B) don't mind waiting for a table, as its C) a nice place to share your food without being disgusting.My friend told me she had to have a snack later that evening, as she was still hungry. Yes, we're first rate penny-pinchers. No way around it.

5lHuIgOuIv4wTYCfZN-FWQ.text: Fabulous, as the other reviews have said. I'm not sure there is *any* cuisine category this place fits into, but the food is wonderful. Lamb 'cannons' tonight with a fantastic piquillo pepper chutney and mustard sauce. Green beans with chilli flakes, garlic and mustard seeds. Definitely worth a visit.
